Comment: Won by 20% contains no ambiguity-- won by 10% might be technically accurate, but it is ambiguous as to whether you are referring to the margin between the candidates or the margin to 50% (although it should technically be 51%). Most people would probably incorrectly assume you meant the first. Also, if you wanted to reference their distance to 50%, you could just *say* that they got 60% of the vote.
